metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: HTML Images
Images can improve the design and the appearance of a web page.
content.html: Images can improve the design and the appearance of a web page.

content.code_html: <img src="pic_trulli.jpg" alt="Italian Trulli">
<img src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket">
<img src="img_chania.jpg" alt="Flowers in Chania">

content.text: HTML Images Syntax
The HTML tag is used to embed an image in a web page.
content.html: The HTML <img> tag is used to embed an image in a web page.

content.text: Images are not technically inserted into a web page; images are linked to web pages. The tag creates a holding space for the referenced image.
content.html: Images are not technically inserted into a web page; images are linked to web pages. The <img> tag creates a holding space for the referenced image.

content.text: The tag is empty, it contains attributes only, and does not have a closing tag.
content.html: The <img> tag is empty, it contains attributes only, and does not have a closing tag.

content.text: The tag has two required attributes:
content.html: The <img> tag has two required attributes:

content.code_html: <img src="url" alt="alternatetext">

content.text: The src Attribute
The required src attribute specifies the path (URL) to the image.
content.html: The required src attribute specifies the path (URL) to the image.

content.text: Note: When a web page loads, it is the browser, at that moment, that gets the image from a web server and inserts it into the page. Therefore, make sure that the image actually stays in the same spot in relation to the web page, otherwise your visitors will get a broken link icon. The broken link icon and the alt text are shown if the browser cannot find the image.
content.html: Note: When a web page loads, it is the browser, at that moment, that gets the image from a web server and inserts it into the page. Therefore, make sure that the image actually stays in the same spot in relation to the web page, otherwise your visitors will get a broken link icon. The broken link icon and the alt text are shown if the browser cannot find the image.

content.code_html: <img src="img_chania.jpg" alt="Flowers in Chania">

content.text: The alt Attribute

The required alt attribute provides an alternate text for an image, if the user for some reason cannot view it (because of slow connection, an error in the src attribute, or if the user uses a screen reader).
content.html: The required alt attribute provides an alternate text for an image, if the user for some reason cannot view it (because of slow connection, an error in the src attribute, or if the user uses a screen reader).

content.text: The value of the alt attribute should describe the image:
content.html: The value of the alt attribute should describe the image:

content.code_html: <img src="img_chania.jpg" alt="Flowers in Chania">

content.text: If a browser cannot find an image, it will display the value of the alt attribute:
content.html: If a browser cannot find an image, it will display the value of the alt attribute:

content.code_html: <img src="wrongname.gif" alt="Flowers in Chania">

content.text: Tip: A screen reader is a software program that reads the HTML code, and allows the user to "listen" to the content. Screen readers are useful for people who are visually impaired or learning disabled.
content.html: Tip: A screen reader is a software program that reads the HTML code, and allows the user to "listen" to the content. Screen readers are useful for people who are visually impaired or learning disabled.

content.text: Image Size - Width and Height
You can use the style attribute to specify the width and height of an image.
content.html: You can use the style attribute to specify the width and height of an image.

syntaxHighlighting.text: src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" style="width:500px;height:600px;"

syntax_highlighting.text: src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" style="width:500px;height:600px;"

content.code_html: <img src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" style="width:500px;height:600px;">

syntax_highlighting_data.text: src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" style="width:500px;height:600px;"

content.text: Alternatively, you can use the width and height attributes:
content.html: Alternatively, you can use the width and height attributes:

syntaxHighlighting.text: src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" width="500" height="600"

syntax_highlighting.text: src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" width="500" height="600"

content.code_html: <img src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" width="500" height="600">

syntax_highlighting_data.text: src="img_girl.jpg" alt="Girl in a jacket" width="500" height="600"

content.text: The width and height attributes always define the width and height of the image in pixels.
content.html: The width and height attributes always define the width and height of the image in pixels.

content.text: Note: Always specify the width and height of an image. If width and height are not specified, the web page might flicker while the image loads.
content.html: Note: Always specify the width and height of an image. If width and height are not specified, the web page might flicker while the image loads.

content.text: Width and Height, or Style?
The width , height , and style attributes are all valid in HTML.
content.html: The width, height, and style attributes are all valid in HTML.

content.text: However, we suggest using the style attribute. It prevents styles sheets from changing the size of images:
content.html: However, we suggest using the style attribute. It prevents styles sheets from changing the size of images:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<style>
img {
  width: 100%;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<img src="html5.gif" alt="HTML5 Icon" width="128" height="128">

<img src="html5.gif" alt="HTML5 Icon" style="width:128px;height:128px;">

</body>
</html>

content.text: Images in Another Folder
If you have your images in a sub-folder, you must include the folder name in the src attribute:
content.html: If you have your images in a sub-folder, you must include the folder name in the src attribute:

content.code_html: <img src="/images/html5.gif" alt="HTML5 Icon" style="width:128px;height:128px;">

content.text: Images on Another Server/Website
Some web sites point to an image on another server.
content.html: Some web sites point to an image on another server.

content.text: To point to an image on another server, you must specify an absolute (full) URL in the src attribute:
content.html: To point to an image on another server, you must specify an absolute (full) URL in the src attribute:

content.code_html: <img src="https://www.w3schools.com/images/w3schools_green.jpg" alt="W3Schools.com">

content.text: Notes on external images: External images might be under copyright. If you do not get permission to use it, you may be in violation of copyright laws. In addition, you cannot control external images; they can suddenly be removed or changed.
content.html: Notes on external images: External images might be under copyright. If you do not get permission to use it, you may be in violation of copyright laws. In addition, you cannot control external images; they can suddenly be removed or changed.

content.text: Animated Images
HTML allows animated GIFs:
content.html: HTML allows animated GIFs:

content.code_html: <img src="programming.gif" alt="Computer Man" style="width:48px;height:48px;">

content.text: Image as a Link
To use an image as a link, put the tag inside the tag:
content.html: To use an image as a link, put the <img> tag inside the <a> tag:

content.code_html:
<a href="default.asp">
  <img src="smiley.gif" alt="HTML tutorial" style="width:42px;height:42px;">
</a>

content.text: Image Floating
Use the CSS float property to let the image float to the right or to the left of a text:
content.html: Use the CSS float property to let the image float to the right or to the left of a text:

content.code:
The image will float to the right of the text.

The image will float to the left of the text.
content.code_html:
<p><img src="smiley.gif" alt="Smiley face" style="float:right;width:42px;height:42px;">
The image will float to the right of the text.</p>

<p><img src="smiley.gif" alt="Smiley face" style="float:left;width:42px;height:42px;">
The image will float to the left of the text.</p>

content.text: Tip: To learn more about CSS Float, read our CSS Float Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: To learn more about CSS Float, read our CSS Float Tutorial.

content.text: Common Image Formats
Here are the most common image file types, which are supported in all browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari, Opera):
content.html: Here are the most common image file types, which are supported in all browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari, Opera):

content.code_html:
Abbreviation File Format File Extension
APNG Animated Portable Network Graphics .apng
GIF Graphics Interchange Format .gif
ICO Microsoft Icon .ico, .cur
JPEG Joint Photographic Expert Group image .jpg, .jpeg, .jfif, .pjpeg, .pjp
PNG Portable Network Graphics .png
SVG Scalable Vector Graphics .svg

content.text: Chapter Summary
Note: Loading large images takes time, and can slow down your web page. Use images carefully.
content.html: Note: Loading large images takes time, and can slow down your web page. Use images carefully.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct HTML element for adding an image?
content.html: What is a correct HTML element for adding an image?

metadata.question: What is a correct HTML element for adding an image?

content.question: What is a correct HTML element for adding an image?

content.text: HTML Image Tags

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<img> Defines an image
<map> Defines an image map
<area> Defines a clickable area inside an image map
<picture> Defines a container for multiple image resources

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.

content.text: Video: HTML Images
